gov.nih.nlm.ling.process

Class IndicatorAnnotator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.process.IndicatorAnnotator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TermAnnotator

    public class IndicatorAnnotator
extends java.lang.Object
implements TermAnnotator
    An annotator for indicators (predicates). It currently can annotate single-word, multi-word, or gapped indicators.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • getIgnorePOS

        public boolean getIgnorePOS()
        Returns whether to ignore part-of-speech for annotation. If the indicator set only has result[VB], for example, if ignorePOS variable is false, this annotator will not annotate result[NN] tokens.
        Returns:
        true if this variable has been set.

      • setIgnorePOS

        public void setIgnorePOS(boolean ignorePOS)

      • allowMultipleAnnotations

        public boolean allowMultipleAnnotations()
        Returns whether multiple indicator annotations are allowed over the same text.
        Returns:
        true if this variable has been set.

      • setAllowMultipleAnnotations

        public void setAllowMultipleAnnotations(boolean allowMultipleAnnotations)

      • postHyphenMatch

        public boolean postHyphenMatch()
        Returns whether, if the token is hyphenated, the post-hyphen substring is allowed to be an indicator
        Returns:
        true if this variable has been set.

      • setPostHyphenMatch

        public void setPostHyphenMatch(boolean postHyphenMatch)

      • annotate

        public void annotate(Document document,
                     java.util.Properties props,
                     java.util.Map<SpanList,java.util.LinkedHashSet<Ontology>> annotations)
        Description copied from interface: TermAnnotator
        Annotates a given document with terms.
        Specified by:
        annotate in interface TermAnnotator
        Parameters:
        document - the document to annotate
        props - the properties to read annotation parameters from, if any
        annotations - the resulting annotations with their span as they key

      • annotateIndicators

        public void annotateIndicators(Document document,
                               java.util.Properties props)
        Annotates a given Document with the loaded indicators and creates the corresponding Predicate objects for the mentions, as well.
        Parameters:
        document - the document to annotate
        props - the properties to use for annotation

      • annotateWord

        public void annotateWord(Document document,
                         Indicator indicator,
                         java.util.Map<SpanList,java.util.LinkedHashSet<Ontology>> annotations)
        Annotates single-word indicators. If the word being examined is hyphenated, it attempts to annotate the indicator on part of the word, as well.
        Parameters:
        document - the document
        indicator - the indicator
        annotations - the updated annotations list

      • annotateMultiWord

        public void annotateMultiWord(Document document,
                              Indicator indicator,
                              java.util.Map<SpanList,java.util.LinkedHashSet<Ontology>> annotations)
        Annotates multi-word, single span indicators.
        Parameters:
        document - the document
        indicator - the indicator
        annotations - the updated annotations list

      • annotateGapped

        public void annotateGapped(Document document,
                           Indicator indicator,
                           int sentWindowSize,
                           java.util.Map<SpanList,java.util.LinkedHashSet<Ontology>> annotations)
        Annotates gapped indicators. It requires a sentence window as input, so that it knows how far to look ahead for different parts of the indicator. The sentence window size includes the current sentence, so a size of 2 means the current sentence and the next.
        Parameters:
        document - the document
        indicator - the gapped indicator
        sentWindowSize - the sentence window size
        annotations - the resulting annotations
